climbs.name: F.X. Special
climbs.fa: Tom Carter, Kim Milburn, Francis Connors  1996

content.description: Somewhat chossy climbing leads to a high bolt.  Ever easier face climbing leads past the rest tot he anchors.  Ok route, but the second bolt looks terrible and it moves in the hole a bit.  Back it up by slinging a chickenhead out left.
content.protection: 4 bolts (used to be 5, looks like a low one is gone).  2 bolt rap anchor.
content.location: This is the farthest route right in this section.  It climbs the buttress with Cool Breeze right around the corner and a left facing dihedral crack to the left.

content.description: Rotten start, probably why its a PG rating. There is a horizontal slot about 20' up. But everything up to it is hollow and flaky. Above is solid chickenhead and plates...good pro.
content.protection: Few pieces, normal rack. The Fennel guide incorrectly states that there is a bolted anchor, which there is not.  You must build a tree anchor or traverse to the anchors on neighboring routes.
content.location: To the right of tying the knot (prominent dihedral crack, 5.6). Starts in a choss band on the south facing face, directly left of FX Special.  This route may be climbed more safely by clipping the bolts of FX Special through the choss band, then continuing up and left.

content.description: Casual jug bash well worth doing. Route moves left at the top. A beautiful, colored face with many pockets and jugs. Good movement up and left.
content.location: Located on a yellow streaked wall around the corner to the left of Attack of the Killer Gnats crack.

content.description: The route starts in a thin crack system with a high first bolt. Move left out of the crack and through a series of bulges to the anchors.
content.location: First sport route directly on the left side of the Breeze Way. Starts in a thin-crack system.

content.description: The style of climbing on this route is basically the antithesis of its' neighbor, Choss Man. Easy climbing up the choss band crack leads to a high second bolt and much better rock. As the wall gets steeper, multiple overlaps make the holds tricky to see. Expect committing moves and a tough clip through a series of interesting slopers near the last bolt. In keeping with the feels of the FA (groundup, onsight on gear), this might feel a tad spicy.
Climb the orange face on good rock, following bolts.  Very fun.
content.protection: 8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: At the left end of Area C, this is the 1st bolted line right of the cave where Breeze Way starts.

content.description: Start just left of crack on rock that's better than you'd expect at first glance. Crux comes at the bulge using mostly crimps to move onto the vertical face. The rock quality increase on the upper face and the climbing remains sustained in the 5.9-10 range.
content.location: Found on the left end of the Buddhist Alcove wall near a orange chossy looking arete. There is a bush guarding the start and the ground slopes up towards the corner that leads to a top access point.

content.description: This area centers on the large cave, Breeze Way, along the main bluff line. South facing.  This area is the first area beyond the Stems and Seeds area, but before you get to the Meat Walls.  It is mostly south facing, and the routes get morning and evening shade, but get plenty of sun during the day.  The rock tends to be lower quality with a few exceptions.
